update.description:
All command line tools have been refactored into one unified tool: gz. This matches functionality of other tools, like hg and git.

The usage is now: `gz <command> [options]`, where <commands> are string like "topic", "log", "joint", etc.

A complete list of commands is available by using gz with no arguments.

Help on each command is available using gz help <command>

Tab completion is also in effect. You'll need to manually install this file using: `sudo cp tools/gazebo.bash-completion /etc/bash_completion.d/`. This file will be installed when installing from [debian](#!/osrf/gazebo-release/pull-request/12/support-to-install-bash-completion-script/diff).

**08:15 Feb 25, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/294/)

**07:41 Mar 14, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/378)
update.title: New command line tool

content.raw: I wouldn't recommend an in-place conversion, but a dynamic conversion of the loaded sdf file at runtime. This may be bad for performance reasons, but there are maintenance advantages.
content.html: I wouldn't recommend an in-place conversion, but a dynamic conversion of the loaded sdf file at runtime. This may be bad for performance reasons, but there are maintenance advantages.

content.raw: The other option would be to silently convert any file without a warning. This would be cleaner, but I believe silent conversion was not very popular.
content.html: The other option would be to silently convert any file without a warning. This would be cleaner, but I believe silent conversion was not very popular.

content.raw: I think #1003 is also an issue for the gz unit test.
content.html: I think #1003 is also an issue for the gz unit test.

content.raw:
In my opinion, we shouldn't have to update the models for this test to pass. The test seems brittle to me. It feels like we throw away one of the advantages of the automatic converter script by always updating the models when we bump the sdf version. I created
[sdformat issue 44](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issue/44/parse-old-versions-of-sdf-files-without)
to discuss this.
content.html: In my opinion, we shouldn't have to update the models for this test to pass. The test seems brittle to me. It feels like we throw away one of the advantages of the automatic converter script by always updating the models when we bump the sdf version. I created sdformat issue 44 to discuss this.

I would like to add a QA check so we are sure that the returned connection is, indeed, a valid one.

Does something like this make sense?


```
#!c++

GZ_ASSERT(connection->IsOpen())
```

content.raw: The Connect method will return false if the connection failed, we should add an else clause that handle this option, probably with an error message and the return of a new ConnectionPtr.
content.html: The Connect method will return false if the connection failed, we should add an else clause that handle this option, probably with an error message and the return of a new ConnectionPtr.
